author: A Whimsical Lake
title: The aftermath of the food price hike, which has continued since the beginning of the year, is expect.. - MK
text:
The aftermath of the food price hike, which has continued since the beginning of the year, is expected to continue after the Lunar New Year holiday. Companies that are under pressure to raise costs due to prolonged high prices and high exchange rates following the aftermath of the impeachment are forced to make price hikes.
According to the Korea Consumer Organization Council's Price Monitoring Center on the 31st, prices of 39 daily necessities sold by 420 retailers in Seoul and Gyeonggi Province in the fourth quarter of last year rose 1.1% year-on-year on average.
Prices of a total of 19 items rose 4.1% on average, including seasoned laver (23.6%), red pepper paste (9.9%), soy sauce (7.9%), sesame oil (7.2%), and ketchup (6.4%).
Earlier, there were price hikes for products sold at large supermarkets or supermarkets.
Ottogi will raise the price of seven types of cup rice by 12.5% from the 1st of next month and raise the price of its old beef bone soup (500g) by 20%. As a result, the price of seven convenience stores, including cup rice, kimchi tuna rice, Ottogi curry, beef brisket soy bean paste barley rice, sesame oil kimchi fried rice, tuna mayo rice, chicken mayo rice, and talk kimchi rice, will increase by 600 won from 4,800 won to 5,400 won. The price of Ottogi beef bone soup in the old days is 3,000 won, up 500 won from 2,500 won.
Dong-A Otsuka raised the price of drinks such as Pocari Sweat by an average of 6.3%, and Daesang has raised the price of sauce products such as clean mayonnaise and dressing and pepper by an average of 19.1% since the 16th.
The price of eating out has also risen one after another.
According to a survey by the Korea Consumer Agency, prices of seven restaurant menus in Seoul rose an average of 40.2 percent from December 2014 a decade ago.
In particular, the price of jajangmyeon rose 65.0% from 4,500 won to 7,423 won during this period, the largest increase.
Cold noodles prices also jumped 50% from 8,000 won to 12,000 won, and kimchi stew and kalguksu also showed a high price increase of 44.4%. Bibimbap rose 423. percent and pork belly rose 39.5 percent, respectively.
Franchisees are also raising prices this year.
Burger King decided to raise the prices of some products by 100 won just before the Lunar New Year holiday. As a result, the Whopper, the representative menu, will increase from 7,100 won to 7,200 won, and the Garlic Bulgogi Whopper will increase from 7,400 won to 7,500 won. Whopper Jr. costs 4,700 won to 4,800 won.
Starbucks will raise the price of 22 tall-sized drinks by 200 won to 300 won, while Grande and Venti sizes will increase by 100 won. Paul Basset, run by M's Seed, an affiliate of Maeil Dairy, also raised its prices by 200 won to 400 won from the 23rd, while Hallis and Coffee Bean also raised some prices.
It is predicted that this trend of increasing food prices will continue after the Lunar New Year holiday.
An industry official said, "The price of raw materials is also on the rise as internal and external instability continues as the impeachment phase has not been organized," adding, "If this situation is maintained, the industry will have no choice but to raise prices."
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->financial and economic news
